3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **

8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **

11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description:	The main routine of Tcl Modules including all of     **
14   |  **			the global data.				     **
15   |  ** 									     **
16   |  **   Exports:		main		Main program			     **
17   |  **			module_usage	Module usage information	     **
18   |  **			Tcl_AppInit	Tcl Application initialization	     **
19   |  ** 									     **
20   |  **   Notes:								     **

32   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: main.c.src.html,v 1.9 2009/09/02 20:37:41 rkowen Exp $";
33   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
34   | 
35   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
36   | /** 				      HEADERS				     **/
37   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
38   | 
39   | #include "modules_def.h"
40   | #include "getopt.h"
41   | 
42   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
43   | /** 				  LOCAL DATATYPES			     **/
44   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
45   | 
46   | /** not applicable **/
47   | 
48   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
49   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
50   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
51   | 
52   | /** not applicable **/
53   | 
54   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
55   | /** 				    COMMON STRINGS			     **/
56   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
57   | 
58   | /* TRANSLATORS: The next five are the common strings */
59   | char	em_reading[]	= N_("reading");
60   | char	em_writing[]	= N_("writing");
61   | char	em_appending[]	= N_("appending");
62   | char	em_read_write[]	= N_("read/write");
63   | char	em_unknown[]	= N_("unknown");
64   | /* TRANSLATORS: id string for default versions */
65   | char	em_default[]	= N_("default"); 
66   | 
67   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
68   | /** 				    GLOBAL DATA				     **/
69   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
70   | 
71   | char	 *g_current_module = NULL,	/** The module which is handled by   **/
72   | 					/** the current command		     **/
73   | 	 *g_specified_module = NULL,	/** The module that was specified    **/
74   | 					/** on the command line		     **/
75   | 	 *g_module_path = NULL,		/** The path to the module	     **/
76   | 	 *shell_name,			/** Name of the shell		     **/
77   | 					/** (first parameter to modulcmd)    **/
78   | 	 *shell_derelict,		/** Shell family (sh, csh, etc)	     **/
79   | 	 *shell_init,			/** Shell init script name	     **/
80   | 	 *shell_cmd_separator,		/** Shell command separator char     **/
81   | 	  _colon[] = ":";		/** directory separator		     **/
82   | int	  g_flags = 0,			/** Control what to do at the moment **/
83   | 					/** The posible values are defined in**/
84   | 					/** module_def.h		     **/
85   | 	  g_retval = 0,			/** exit return value		     **/
86   | 	  g_output = 0,			/** Has output been generated	     **/
87   | 	  append_flag = 0;		/** only used by the 'use' command   **/
88   | 
89   | /**
90   |  **  Name of the rc files
91   |  **  PREFIX points to the location where modules is going to be installed.
92   |  **  It comes from the Makefile
93   |  **/
94   | 
95   | char	*instpath = PREFIX,
96   | 	*rc_file = RCFILE,
97   | 	*modulerc_file = MODULERCFILE,
98   | 	*version_file = VERSIONFILE;
99   | 
100  | /**
101  |  **  pointers for regular expression evaluations
102  |  **/
103  | char
104  |     *addRE      = "^(add|load)", 		/** 'module add <file>'	     **/
105  |     *rmRE       = "^(rm|del|era|remov|unload)",	/** 'module unload <file>'   **/
106  |     *swRE       = "^sw",			/** 'module switch <file>'   **/
107  |     *dispRE     = "^(disp|show)", 		/** 'module display <file>'  **/
108  |     *listRE     = "^li", 			/** 'module list <file>'     **/
109  |     *availRE    = "^av",			/** 'module avail <file>'    **/
110  |     *helpRE     = "^(help|\\?)",		/** 'module help <file>'     **/
111  |     *initRE     = "^init",			/** 'module init'	     **/
112  |     *useRE      = "^use",			/** 'module use <file>'	     **/
113  |     *unuseRE    = "^unuse",			/** 'module unuse <file>'    **/
114  |     *updateRE   = "^update",			/** 'module update'	     **/
115  |     *purgeRE    = "^purge",			/** 'module purge'	     **/
116  |     *clearRE    = "^clear",			/** 'module clear'	     **/
117  |     *whatisRE   = "^wh",			/** 'module whatis'	     **/
118  |     *aproposRE  = "^(apr|key)",			/** 'module apropos'	     **/
119  |     *refreshRE  = "^refr";			/** 'module refresh'	     **/
120  |   
121  | /**
122  |  **  Hash-Tables for all changes to the environment.
123  |  **  ??? What do we save here, the old or the new setup ???
124  |  **/
125  | 
126  | Tcl_HashTable	*setenvHashTable,
127  | 		*unsetenvHashTable,
128  | 		*aliasSetHashTable,
129  | 		*aliasUnsetHashTable,
130  | 		*markVariableHashTable,
131  | 		*markAliasHashTable;
132  | 
133  | /**
134  |  **  A buffer for reading a single line
135  |  **/
136  | 
137  | char	*line = NULL;
138  | 
139  | /**
140  |  **  Flags influenced by the command line switches
141  |  **/
142  | 
143  | int	sw_force = 0,
144  | 	sw_detach = 0,
145  | 	sw_format = 0,
146  | 	sw_verbose = 0,
147  | 	sw_userlvl = UL_ADVANCED,
148  | 	sw_icase = 0;
149  | 
150  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
151  | /** 				    LOCAL DATA				     **/
152  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
153  | 
154  | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
155  | 
156  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING
157  | static	char	_proc_main[] = "main";
158  | #endif
159  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
160  | static	char	_proc_Module_Usage[] = "Module_Usage";
161  | #endif
162  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT
163  | static	char	_proc_Check_Switches[] = "Check_Switches";
164  | static	char	_proc_Tcl_AppInit[] = "Tcl_AppInit";
165  | #endif
166  | 
167  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
168  | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
169  | /** ************************************************************************ **/
170  | 
171  | static int	Check_Switches( int *argc, char *argv[]);
172  | static void	version (FILE *output);
173  | 
174  | /*++++
175  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
176  |  ** 									     **
177  |  **   Function:		main						     **
178  |  ** 									     **
179  |  **   Description:	Main program					     **
180  |  ** 									     **
181  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
182  |  ** 									     **
183  |  **   Parameters:	int	argc		Number of parameters	     **
184  |  **			char	*argv[]		Command line arguments	     **
185  |  **			char	*environ[]	Pointer to the process' en-  **
186  |  **						vironment.		     **
187  |  **   Result:		int	1		Usage information printed    **
188  |  **				TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
189  |  **				other		Return value of the module   **
190  |  **			 			subcomand		     **
191  |  ** 									     **
192  |  **   Attached Globals:	*Ptr	 	by InitializeTcl		     **
193  |  **			*HashTable	by InitializeTcl	 	     **
194  |  ** 									     **
195  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
196  |  ++++*/
197  | 
198  | int	main( int argc, char *argv[], char *environ[]) {
199  | 
200  |     Tcl_Interp	*interp;
201  |     int          return_val = 0;
202  |     char	*rc_name;
203  |     char	*rc_path;
204  | 
205  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING
206  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_main, NULL);
207  | #endif
208  | 
209  | #ifdef HAVE_SETLOCALE
210  | 	/* set local via LC_ALL */
211  | 	setlocale(LC_ALL,"");
212  | #endif
213  | 
214  | #if ENABLE_NLS
215  | 	/* the text message domain. */
216  | 	bindtextdomain(PACKAGE, LOCALEDIR);
217  | 	textdomain(PACKAGE);
218  | #endif
219  | 
220  |     /**
221  |      ** check if first argument is --version or -V then output the
222  |      ** version to stdout.  This is a special circumstance handled
223  |      ** by the regular options.
224  |      **/
225  |     if (argc > 1 && *argv[1] == '-') {
226  |         if (!strcmp("-V", argv[1]) || !strcmp("--version", argv[1])) {
227  | 	    version(stdout);
228  | 	    return 0;
229  |         }
230  |     }
231  |     /**
232  |      **  Initialization. 
233  |      **  Check the command line syntax. There will be no return from the
234  |      **  initialization function in case of invalid command line arguments.
235  |      **/
236  | 
237  |     if( TCL_OK != Initialize_Tcl( &interp, argc, argv, environ))
238  | 	goto unwind0;
239  | 
240  |     if( TCL_OK != Setup_Environment( interp))
241  | 	goto unwind0;
242  | 
243  |     /**
244  |      **  Check for command line switches
245  |      **/
246  | 
247  |     if( TCL_OK != Check_Switches( &argc, argv))
248  | 	goto unwind0;
249  | 
250  |     /**
251  |      **  Figure out, which global RC file to use. This depends on the environ-
252  |      **  ment variable 'MODULERCFILE', which can be set to one of the following:
253  |      **
254  |      **		<filename>	-->	PREFIX/etc/<filename>
255  |      **		<dir>/		-->	<dir>/RC_FILE
256  |      **		<dir>/<file>	-->	<dir>/<file>
257  |      **  Use xgetenv to expand 1 level of env.vars.
258  |      **/
259  | 
260  |     if((rc_name = xgetenv( "MODULERCFILE"))) {
261  | 	/* found something in MODULERCFILE */
262  | 	if((char *) NULL == (rc_path = stringer(NULL,0,rc_name,NULL))) {
263  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
264  | 		goto unwind1;
265  | 	    else
266  | 		null_free((void *) &rc_name);
267  | 	} else {
268  | 	    null_free((void *) &rc_name);
269  | 	    if((char *) NULL == (rc_name = strrchr( rc_path, '/'))) {
270  | 		rc_name = rc_path;
271  | 		rc_path = instpath;
272  | 	    } else
273  | 		*rc_name++ = '\0';
274  | 	    if( !*rc_name) {
275  | 		rc_name = rc_file;
276  | 	    }
277  | 	}
278  |     } else {
279  | 	rc_path = instpath;
280  | 	null_free((void *) &rc_name);
281  | 	rc_name = rc_file;
282  |     }
283  | 
284  |     /**
285  |      **  Finally we have to change PREFIX -> PREFIX/etc
286  |      **/
287  | 
288  |     if( rc_path == instpath) {
289  | 	if((char *) NULL == (rc_path = stringer(NULL,0, instpath,"/etc",NULL))){
290  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
291  | 		goto unwind1;
292  | 	    else
293  | 		rc_path = NULL;
294  | 	
295  | 	}
296  |     }
297  | 
298  |     /**
299  |      **  Source the global and the user defined RC file
300  |      **/
301  | 
302  |     g_current_module = (char *) NULL;
303  | 
304  |     if( TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, rc_path, rc_name) ||
305  | 	TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, getenv( "HOME"), modulerc_file))
306  | 	exit( 1);
307  | 
308  |     if( rc_path)
309  | 	null_free((void *) &rc_path);
310  | 
311  |     /**
312  |      **  Invocation of the module command as specified in the command line
313  |      **/
314  | 
315  |     g_flags = 0;
316  |     return_val = cmdModule((ClientData) 0,interp,(argc-1),
317  | 	(CONST84 char **) (argv + 1));
318  | 
319  |     /**
320  |      **  If we were doing some operation that has already flushed its output,
321  |      **  then we don't need to re-flush the output here.
322  |      **
323  |      **  Also, if we've had an error here, then the whole modulecmd failed
324  |      **  and not just the values for a single modulefile.  So, we'll pass in
325  |      **  a NULL here to indicate that any error message should say that
326  |      **  absolutely NO changes were made to the environment.
327  |      **/
328  | 
329  |     if( TCL_OK == return_val) {
330  | 	Output_Modulefile_Changes( interp);
331  | #ifdef HAS_X11LIBS
332  | 	xresourceFinish( 1);
333  | #endif
334  |     } else {
335  | 	Unwind_Modulefile_Changes( interp, NULL);
336  | #ifdef HAS_X11LIBS
337  | 	xresourceFinish( 0);
338  | #endif
339  |     }
340  | 
341  |     /**
342  |      **  Finally clean up. Delete the required hash tables and conditionally
343  |      **  allocated areas.
344  |      **/
345  | 
346  |     Delete_Global_Hash_Tables();
347  | 
348  |     if( line)
349  | 	null_free((void *) &line);
350  |     if( error_line)
351  | 	null_free((void *) &error_line);
352  | 
353  |     /**
354  |      **  This return value may be evaluated by the calling shell
355  |      **/
356  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING
357  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_main, NULL);
358  | #endif
359  | 
360  |     OutputExit();
361  |     return ( return_val ? return_val : g_retval);
362  | 
363  | unwind2:
364  |     null_free((void *) &rc_path);
365  | unwind1:
366  |     null_free((void *) &rc_name);
367  | unwind0:
368  | 
369  |     /* and error occurred of some type */
370  |     g_retval = (g_retval ? g_retval : 1);
371  |     OutputExit();
372  |     return (g_retval);
373  | 
374  | } /** End of 'main' **/
375  | 
376  | /*++++
377  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
378  |  ** 									     **
379  |  **   Function:		module_usage					     **
380  |  ** 									     **
381  |  **   Description:	Lists out the helpful usage info that we've all come **
382  |  ** 			to expect from unix commands.			     **
383  |  ** 									     **
384  |  **   First Edition:	2002/10/13					     **
385  |  ** 									     **
386  |  **   Parameters:	FILE	*output		Where the output goes	     **
387  |  ** 									     **
388  |  **   Result:		void			No return values	     **
389  |  ** 									     **
390  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
391  |  ** 			version_string		Current module version	     **
392  |  ** 			date_string		Current module date	     **
393  |  ** 									     **
394  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
395  |  ++++*/
396  | 
397  | void module_usage(FILE *output)
398  | {
399  |     /**
400  |      **  General help wanted.
401  |      **/
402  | 
403  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_MODULECMD
404  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Module_Usage, NULL);
405  | #endif
406  | 
407  | 	fprintf(output,
408  | 		_("\n  Modules Release %s %s (Copyright GNU GPL v2 1991):\n\n"),
409  |                 version_string,date_string);
410  | 	
411  | 	fprintf(output,
412  | /* TRANSLATORS: keep the options and formatting the same */
413  | _(
414  | "  Usage: module [ switches ] [ subcommand ] [subcommand-args ]\n\n"
415  | "Switches:\n"
416  | "	-H|--help		this usage info\n"
417  | "	-V|--version		modules version & configuration options\n"
418  | "	-f|--force		force active dependency resolution\n"
419  | "	-t|--terse		terse    format avail and list format\n"
420  | "	-l|--long		long     format avail and list format\n"
421  | "	-h|--human		readable format avail and list format\n"
422  | "	-v|--verbose		enable  verbose messages\n"
423  | "	-s|--silent		disable verbose messages\n"
424  | "	-i|--icase		case insensitive\n"
425  | "	-u|--userlvl <lvl>	set user level to (nov[ice],exp[ert],adv[anced])\n"
426  | "  Available SubCommands and Args:\n"
427  | "	+ add|load		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
428  | "	+ rm|unload		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
429  | "	+ switch|swap		[modulefile1] modulefile2\n"
430  | "	+ display|show		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
431  | "	+ avail			[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
432  | "	+ use [-a|--append]	dir [dir ...]\n"
433  | "	+ unuse			dir [dir ...]\n"));
434  | #ifdef BEGINENV
435  | 	fprintf(output,_(
436  | "	+ update\n"));
437  | #endif
438  | 	fprintf(output,_(
439  | "	+ refresh\n"
440  | "	+ purge\n"
441  | "	+ list\n"
442  | "	+ clear\n"
443  | "	+ help			[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
444  | "	+ whatis		[modulefile [modulefile ...]]\n"
445  | "	+ apropos|keyword	string\n"
446  | "	+ initadd		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
447  | "	+ initprepend		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
448  | "	+ initrm		modulefile [modulefile ...]\n"
449  | "	+ initswitch		modulefile1 modulefile2\n"
450  | "	+ initlist\n"
451  | "	+ initclear\n\n"));
452  | 
453  | } /** End of 'module_usage' **/
454  | 
455  | /*++++
456  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
457  |  ** 									     **
458  |  **   Function:		Tcl_AppInit					     **
459  |  ** 									     **
460  |  **   Description:	This is needed if you use shared TCL libraries.	     **
461  |  **			It won't be called, but the linker complains if it   **
462  |  **		   	doesn't exist.					     **
463  |  ** 									     **
464  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
465  |  ** 									     **
466  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter to   **
467  |  **							be initialized	     **
468  |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Initialization succ. **
469  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
470  |  ** 									     **
471  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
472  |  ++++*/
473  | 
474  | int Tcl_AppInit(Tcl_Interp *interp)
475  | {
476  | 
477  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT
478  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Tcl_AppInit, NULL);
479  | #endif
480  | 
481  |     return( TCL_OK);
482  | 
483  | } /** End of 'Tcl_AppInit' **/
484  | 
485  | /*++++
486  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
487  |  ** 									     **
488  |  **   Function:		Check_Switches					     **
489  |  ** 									     **
490  |  **   Description:	Check for command line switches and set internal     **
491  |  **			control variable according to them. Command line     **
492  |  **			switches are defined to appear between the shell and **
493  |  **			the module command. They begin on a dash and may     **
494  |  **			appear in long and short format. 		     **
495  |  **									     **
496  |  **			The following switches are defined:		     **
497  |  **									     **
498  |  **			    --force, -f		Force prerequired actions    **
499  |  **			    --terse, -t		Terse, parseable messages    **
500  |  **			    --human, -h		Human readable form          **
501  |  **			    --long, -l		Long messages		     **
502  |  **			    --verbose, -v	Verbose mode on		     **
503  |  **			    --silent, -s	Verbose mode off	     **
504  |  **			    --userlvl, -u	Change the user level	     **
505  |  **			    --icase, -i		Ignore case of modulefile    **
506  |  **						names			     **
507  |  **			    --help, -H		Helpful usage info	     **
508  |  **			    --version, -V	Report version only	     **
509  |  ** 									     **
510  |  **   First Edition:	1995/12/20					     **
511  |  ** 									     **
512  |  **   Parameters:	int	*argc		Number of parameters	     **
513  |  **			char	*argv[]		Command line arguments	     **
514  |  **									     **
515  |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
516  |  **				TCL_ERROR	Unknown switch found	     **
517  |  **			*argc, *argv		All switches are removed     **
518  |  **						from the argv vector	     **
519  |  ** 									     **
520  |  **   Attached Globals:	sw_force		--force, -f		     **
521  |  **			sw_format		-t, -l, -h, -p               **
522  |  **			sw_verbose		--verbose, -v, --silent, -s  **
523  |  **			sw_userlvl		--userlvl, -u		     **
524  |  **			sw_icase		--icase, -i		     **
525  |  ** 									     **
526  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
527  |  ++++*/
528  | 
529  | static int	Check_Switches( int *argc, char *argv[])
530  | {
531  | 
532  |     int c;
533  | 
534  |     /**
535  |      **  These are the options we do provide
536  |      **/
537  | 
538  |     const struct option longopts[] = {
539  | 	{ "force", no_argument, NULL, 'f' },
540  | 	{ "terse", no_argument, NULL, 't' },
541  | 	{ "long", no_argument, NULL, 'l' },
542  | 	{ "human", no_argument, NULL, 'h' },
543  | 	{ "parseable", no_argument, NULL, 'p' },
544  | 	{ "parse", no_argument, NULL, 'p' },
545  | 	{ "verbose", no_argument, NULL, 'v' },
546  | 	{ "silent", no_argument, NULL, 's' },
547  | 	{ "icase", no_argument, NULL, 'i' },
548  | 	{ "userlvl", required_argument, NULL, 'u'},
549  | 	{ "append", no_argument, NULL, 'a' },
550  | 	{ "help", no_argument, NULL, 'H' },
551  | 	{ "version", no_argument, NULL, 'V' },
552  | 	{ NULL, no_argument, NULL, 0 }
553  |     };
554  | 
555  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT
556  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Check_Switches, NULL);
557  | #endif
558  | 
559  |     /**
560  |      **  Scan the command line for options defined in the longopt table.
561  |      **  Skip the very first argument, which is the shell to be used
562  |      **/
563  | 
564  |     if( *argc > 1) {
565  | 
566  | 	while( EOF != (c = getopt_long( *argc-1, &argv[1], "hpftlvsciu:aHV",
567  | 	    longopts, NULL))) {
568  | 
569  | 	    switch( c) {
570  | 
571  | 		/**
572  | 		 **  Force
573  | 		 **/
574  | 
575  | 		case 'f':			/* force */
576  | 		    sw_force = 1;
577  | 		    break;
578  | 
579  | 		/**
580  | 		 **  Format of the messages
581  | 		 **/
582  | 
583  | 		case 't':			/* terse */
584  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_TERSE);
585  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_LONG;
586  | 		    break;
587  | 
588  | 		case 'l':			/* long */
589  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_LONG);
590  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_TERSE;
591  | 		    break;
592  | 
593  | 		case 'h':			/* human */
594  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_HUMAN);
595  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_PARSE;
596  | 		    break;
597  | 
598  | 		case 'p':			/* parseable */
599  | 		    sw_format |= (SW_SET | SW_PARSE);
600  | 		    sw_format &= ~ SW_HUMAN;
601  | 		    break;
602  | 
603  | 		/**
604  | 		 **  Verbosity
605  | 		 **/
606  | 
607  | 		case 'v':			/* verbose */
608  | 		    sw_verbose = 1;
609  | 		    break;
610  | 
611  | 		case 's':			/* silent */
612  | 		    sw_detach = 1;
613  | 		    break;
614  | 
615  | 		/**
616  | 		 **  Locating
617  | 		 **/
618  | 
619  | 		case 'i':			/* icase */
620  | 		    sw_icase = 1;
621  | 		    break;
622  | 
623  | 		/**
624  | 		 **  The user level comes as a string argument to the -u option
625  | 		 **/
626  | 
627  | 		case 'u':			/* userlvl */
628  | 		    cmdModuleUser_sub( optarg);
629  | 		    break;
630  | 
631  | 		/**
632  | 		 **  a special purpose flag for 'use' only
633  | 		 **/
634  | 		case 'a':			/* --append */
635  | 		    append_flag = 1;
636  | 		    break;
637  | 
638  | 		case 'H':			/* helpful info */
639  | 		    module_usage(stderr);
640  | 		    return ~TCL_OK;
641  | 
642  | 		case 'V':			/* version */
643  | 		    version(stderr);
644  | 		    return ~TCL_OK;
645  | 
646  | 		/**
647  | 		 **  All remaining options will influence their flags as defined
648  | 		 **  in the optlong table above.
649  | 		 **/
650  | 
651  | 		case 0:
652  | 		    break;
653  | 
654  | 		/**
655  | 		 **  Error messages for unknown options will be printed by
656  | 		 **  getopt ...
657  | 		 **/
658  | 
659  | 		case '?':
660  | 		    break;
661  | 
662  | 		/**
663  | 		 **  Well, this seems to be an internal error
664  | 		 **/
665  | 
666  | 		default:
667  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_GETOPT, LOC, NULL))
668  | 			return( TCL_ERROR);	/** --- EXIT (FAILURE) ----> **/
669  | 		    break;
670  | 
671  | 	    }  /** switch() **/
672  | 	}  /** while() **/
673  |     } /** if( argc) **/
674  | 
675  |     /**
676  |      **  Special things to be dine for the 'silent' option: Pipe stderr
677  |      **  output to /dev/null
678  |      **/
679  | 
680  |     if( sw_detach) {
681  | 	sw_verbose = 0;
682  | 	if (!ttyname(2)) {
683  | 	    int temp_fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR);
684  | 
685  | 	    close(2);
686  | 	    dup2(temp_fd, 2);
687  | 	}
688  |     }
689  | 
690  |     /**
691  |      **  Finally remove all options from the command line stream
692  |      **/
693  | 
694  |     c = optind - 1;
695  |     if( optind < *argc && c > 0) {
696  | 	while( optind < *argc) {
697  | 	    argv[ optind-c] = argv[ optind];
698  | 	    optind++;
699  | 	}
700  | 	*argc -= c;
701  |     }
702  | 
703  |     /**
704  |      **  Exit on success
705  |      **/
706  | 
707  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_INIT
708  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_Check_Switches, NULL);
709  | #endif
710  | 
711  |     return( TCL_OK);
712  | 
713  | } /** End of 'Check_Switches' **/
714  | 
715  | /*++++
716  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
717  |  ** 									     **
718  |  **   Function:		dup2						     **
719  |  ** 									     **
720  |  **   Description:	Duplicate file descriptor			     **
721  |  ** 									     **
722  |  **   First Edition:	1996/02/08					     **
723  |  ** 									     **
724  |  **   Parameters:	int	old		Old file descriptor	     **
725  |  **			int	new		New file descriptor	     **
726  |  **									     **
727  |  **   Result:		int	-1		any error		     **
728  |  **				other		new file descriptor	     **
729  |  ** 									     **
730  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
731  |  ++++*/
732  | 
733  | #ifndef HAVE_DUP2
734  | int dup2( int old, int new)
735  | {
736  |     int fd;
737  | 
738  |     close(new);
739  |     fd = dup(old);
740  |     if (fd != new) {
741  | 	close( fd);
742  | 	errno = EMFILE;
743  | 	fd = -1;
744  |     }
745  | 
746  |     return( fd);
747  | }
748  | #endif
749  | 
750  | /*++++
751  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
752  |  ** 									     **
753  |  **   Function:		version						     **
754  |  ** 									     **
755  |  **   Description:	Outputs the Modules version and features	     **
756  |  ** 									     **
757  |  **   First Edition:	2002/06/13					     **
758  |  ** 									     **
759  |  **   Parameters:	FILE *	output		All input is from defined    **
760  |  **						macros			     **
761  |  **   Result:		void			no return value		     **
762  |  **						All output is to output	     **
763  |  ** 									     **
764  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
765  |  ** 			version_string		Current module version	     **
766  |  ** 			date_string		Current module date	     **
767  |  **									     **
768  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
769  |  ++++*/
770  | 
771  | #define str(a) #a
772  | #define isdefined(a,b)	{if (strcmp(str(a),b)) x=str(a); else x="undef"; \
773  | 			fprintf(output,format,b,x);}
774  | 
775  | static void version (FILE *output) {
776  | 	char	*x,
777  | 		*format = "%s=%s\n";
778  | 
779  | 	fprintf(output, format, _("VERSION"), version_string);
780  | 	fprintf(output, format, _("DATE"), date_string);
781  | 	fprintf(output, "\n");
782  | 
783  | 	isdefined(AUTOLOADPATH,str(AUTOLOADPATH));
784  | 	isdefined(BASEPREFIX,str(BASEPREFIX));
785  | 	isdefined(BEGINENV,str(BEGINENV));
786  | 	isdefined(DEF_COLLATE_BY_NUMBER,str(DEF_COLLATE_BY_NUMBER));
787  | 	isdefined(DOT_EXT,str(DOT_EXT));
788  | 	isdefined(ENABLE_NLS,str(ENABLE_NLS));
789  | 	isdefined(EVAL_ALIAS,str(EVAL_ALIAS));
790  | 	isdefined(HAS_BOURNE_ALIAS,str(HAS_BOURNE_ALIAS));
791  | 	isdefined(HAS_BOURNE_FUNCS,str(HAS_BOURNE_FUNCS));
792  | 	isdefined(HAS_TCLXLIBS,str(HAS_TCLXLIBS));
793  | 	isdefined(HAS_X11LIBS,str(HAS_X11LIBS));
794  | 	isdefined(LMSPLIT_SIZE,str(LMSPLIT_SIZE));
795  | 	isdefined(MODULEPATH,str(MODULEPATH));
796  | 	isdefined(MODULES_INIT_DIR,str(MODULES_INIT_DIR));
797  | 	isdefined(PREFIX,str(PREFIX));
798  | 	isdefined(TCL_VERSION,str(TCL_VERSION));
799  | 	isdefined(TCL_PATCH_LEVEL,str(TCL_PATCH_LEVEL));
800  | 	isdefined(TMP_DIR,str(TMP_DIR));
801  | 	isdefined(USE_FREE,str(USE_FREE));
802  | 	isdefined(VERSION_MAGIC,str(VERSION_MAGIC));
803  | 	isdefined(VERSIONPATH,str(VERSIONPATH));
804  | 	isdefined(WANTS_VERSIONING,str(WANTS_VERSIONING));
805  | 	isdefined(WITH_DEBUG_INFO,str(WITH_DEBUG_INFO));
806  | 
807  |   	fprintf(output, "\n");
808  | }
809  | 
810  | #undef str
811  | #undef isdefined
